page.title: 09Industry in NW Derby
page.content: These old established firms have adapted to technological progress: {Davis of Derby,}employing 400, make communication and monitoring equipment to be used in dangerous places like mines. They export to Turkey, China, Indonesia and America.{Pektrons}make electronics equipment for cars, employing 180 in 2 factories. They export to Germany and Holland. {Aitons'}968 employees make steel pipes for nuclear power stations, exporting to South Africa and Australia. {Parker Foundry,}employing 320, make valves for the North Sea oil rigs and export to America and the Common Market.{Cromptons'}550 employees export wire for electrical purposes worldwide.{Newtons,}employing 210, make generators for power stations. They export world-wide except to the Middle East.
